page.title: 16Ditchingham Hall (part 2)
page.content:
The large kitchen garden,so essential an adjunct to country houses of previous centuries,has largely been grassed over with shrubs incorporated in order to make the maintenance of the walled garden as easy as possible. Each generation has its own problems. This generation has tried to preserve this house and its landscape in the context of its own time in the hopes that future generations,in the context of their time,will have something which they too may be able to preserve
Pages 15 & 16 were written by the current owner (who is resident) in Ditchingham Hall: The Rt.Hon.The Earl Ferrers
